summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between federal prosecutors and attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, who represent a bank (likely JPMorgan Chase). The emails discuss scheduling a proffer session where the bank's attorneys will present an overview of Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with the bank, his accounts, and notable transactions, to assist the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in its investigation.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: The primary correspondent representing the bank, proposing and organizing a proffer session to guide SDNY prosecutors through financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.role: Attorney (likely at Akin Gump or associated with the bank)
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, involved in the coordination of the proffer session regarding Epstein's bank records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation. The emails discuss a planned proffer to overview his relationship with a bank, his accounts, and transaction types.

connections.description: Both are attorneys copied on the same email chain, coordinating a legal proffer for a mutual client (a bank) regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Moyne, as an attorney for the bank, is facilitating the production and explanation of financial records related to Epstein's accounts as part of a subpoena response.

events.title: Proposed Proffer Session
events.description: A proposed date for attorneys from Akin Gump to deliver a presentation to SDNY prosecutors on Epstein's banking relationship and transactions.

events.title: Production Index Sent
events.description: Parvin Moyne sends an index of the bank's document productions to date regarding Jeffrey Epstein to the SDNY.

keyFacts: Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP attorneys are representing a bank (implied to be JPMorgan Chase) in responding to a subpoena from the SDNY regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The bank's attorneys plan to give a 2-3 hour attorney proffer to guide prosecutors through Epstein's relationship with the bank, account types, and specific transactions of interest.
The correspondence indicates an active financial investigation into Epstein by the SDNY as of August 2019, focusing on bank records.
The email chain shows coordination to schedule the proffer, with a target date of September 5, 2019, after team members return from Florida.
